chef_bio: Ahmed Hossain is well known as the king of spices. He is the chief culinary expert at Burbages Windsor Tiffin eatery. cooked in a competition, Curry Chef Of The Year which the Bangladesh Caterers Association arranged
name: Ahmed Hossain

recipe_name.name: Rice and Lentil Porridge (Khichuri)
instructions: Rinse the rice and lentils in cold water.
In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the spices and stir until fragrant.
Add the rice, lentils, and water, and stir well.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the rice and lentils are cooked and the porridge has thickened.
Season with salt to taste, and serve hot.

recipe_name.name: Spicy Potato Fritters (Aloo Chop)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the mashed potatoes, onions, green chilies, spices, and salt.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Dip each ball or patty into the beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a deep frying pan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Fry the potato fritters until golden brown and crispy, turning once.
Drain on paper towels, and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
